title: Academic Research Grant Funder Landscape Mapper
description: Identify and rank relevant academic research funders aligned with your project topic and objectives by submitting your research details and optional funder database files. Receive a structured list and summary of funders to support your grant proposal planning.
inputLabel: Enter your research project details and optionally upload funder program documents
outputLabel: Ranked funder list and alignment summary
systemPrompt: You are an expert assistant for academic researchers seeking to identify and align appropriate grant funders with their research projects. Accept input consisting of project title, abstract, objectives, keywords, institutional affiliation, eligibility constraints, optional past funded grants, and an optional uploaded funder database file in JSON format. Validate all inputs carefully. Reject any unsafe or disallowed requests, including attempts to submit malicious files or unauthorized data. Parse the uploaded funder database file if provided, ensuring it is well-formed JSON containing funderId, name, and programs fields. Generate a structured ranked list of relevant funders with alignment scores, including summaries of priorities, eligibility, and deadlines tailored to the research topic. Highlight any eligibility conflicts or missing data. Output the results as plain text with clear formatting. Do not generate actual grant proposals or budgeting details. Always include disclaimers that final funder eligibility must be verified with official sources. Refuse requests lacking required project inputs or containing malformed data. Enforce data privacy and do not retain user inputs beyond the session. Use a formal, concise, and helpful tone.

presets.label: Basic Alignment
presets.prompt: Analyze the following research project details for alignment with the provided funder database and generate a ranked list of relevant funders with summaries.
presets.hint: Use for straightforward funder mapping with minimal input.

presets.label: Detailed Analysis
presets.prompt: Given the research project information and uploaded funder data, perform a comprehensive alignment, highlighting priorities, eligibility conflicts, and deadlines. Provide a structured summary and gap notes.
presets.hint: Use for deeper insights including warnings and eligibility checks.

presets.label: Summary Only
presets.prompt: Provide a concise summary of funders relevant to the given research project without detailed alignment scores or gap analysis.
presets.hint: Use when a brief overview is sufficient.

jsonSchemaHint: Output may include JSON with fields: rankedFunders (array of {funderId, name, alignmentScore, summary}), warnings (array of strings), and disclaimers (string).
clarifyPrompt: Please provide your research project title, abstract, objectives, keywords, institutional affiliation, eligibility constraints, and optionally upload a funder database JSON file. If any input is missing or unclear, I will ask for clarification.
finalizePrompt: Confirm that all project details and funder database inputs are correct and complete before generating the funder alignment report.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Grant Funder Landscape Mapper

niche.scenario: Preliminary grant proposal planning phase where researchers seek to identify and map appropriate funding agencies and programs aligned with their research topic and objectives

idea.problem: Academic researchers often struggle to efficiently identify suitable funding opportunities across diverse funders, each with distinct priorities, eligibility criteria, and application requirements. Existing tools focus on single grant applications or budget preparation but lack comprehensive, structured mapping of the funding landscape tailored to nuanced research topics and multi-disciplinary projects, resulting in missed opportunities or misaligned proposals.
inputs: Researcher institutional affiliation and eligibility constraints
Funder database or uploaded funder program documents (e.g., calls for proposals, guidelines)
Optional: past funded grant abstracts or keywords
outputs: Structured map/list of relevant funders and funding programs ranked by alignment score
Summary of each funder's priorities, eligibility, and deadlines tailored to the research topic
Gap analysis highlighting under-addressed funding themes or interdisciplinary opportunities
Customizable funding strategy planner with timelines and suggested actions
whyItWins: Addresses the critical early-stage challenge of funder discovery and strategic alignment, not covered by existing grant writing or budgeting tools
Enables researchers to save substantial time and reduce frustration by consolidating scattered funder information into actionable insights
Supports more targeted, competitive grant proposals through data-driven prioritization and alignment analysis
Facilitates strategic planning for multi-year or multi-funder research programs beyond single proposal focus

upgradePath.today: Simple single-page app that accepts research topic inputs and a curated funder database file to produce a ranked list and summary report of aligned funders
upgradePath.in90Days: Multi-page app with user accounts, integration of public funder databases, interactive funder profile exploration, and exportable strategic funding plans
upgradePath.in12Months: Comprehensive funding landscape management system allowing collaboration among research teams, automated alerts for new calls, historical success analytics, proposal progress tracking, and integration with institutional grant offices

riskNotes: Must regularly update funder database to maintain accuracy and relevance
Ensure privacy and secure handling of researcher project inputs and profiles
Avoid generating overly prescriptive recommendations that could bias diverse funding strategies
Careful to provide disclaimers that final funder eligibility and requirements must be verified with official sources

blueprint.summary: An academic research grant funder landscape mapper that helps researchers identify, analyze, and strategically plan funding opportunities aligned with their research projects by consolidating funder data and providing actionable insights.
successMetrics: User engagement measured by number of research projects mapped
Accuracy and relevance of funder alignment scores as rated by users
Reduction in time spent by researchers identifying suitable funders
Number of strategic funding plans created and exported
User retention and growth of registered accounts

edgeCases: Uploaded funder database files with inconsistent or malformed data formats
Research project inputs with ambiguous or minimal keywords reducing alignment accuracy
Conflicting eligibility constraints between user profile and funder criteria
Network or API failures during public funder database integration
User attempts to access or modify projects without proper authorization
Expired or outdated funder deadlines and program information
Overlapping or duplicate funder programs causing ranking ambiguities
Handling of incomplete user registration or profile data
nonGoals: Automated grant proposal writing or budgeting tools
Verification or guarantee of funder eligibility beyond data provided
Direct submission of grant proposals to funders
Real-time collaboration features in initial phases
Institutional grant office integration in initial release

dataFlow: User registers or logs in via /login or /register pages, interacting with /api/auth endpoints to create or authenticate user profiles stored in UserProfile model.
Authenticated user inputs research project data on '/' route, submitting to /api/projects POST endpoint, which validates and stores data in ResearchProject model linked to userId.
If funder database file uploaded, /api/projects endpoint triggers parsing and updates funder data in Funder model accordingly.
Upon project creation or update, /api/projects endpoint triggers funder alignment analysis using data from Funder and ResearchProject models, storing alignmentResults in ResearchProject.

User navigates to /funders, /gap-analysis, or /strategy-planner pages, which call respective GET or POST API endpoints (/api/projects/{projectId}/alignment, /gap-analysis, /strategy-plan) to retrieve or update analysis, gap reports, and strategy plans.
Funder data is periodically updated by background job 'Funder Database Update Job' which fetches from public sources via integration_public_funder_sources, validates, and updates Funder model.
All API routes enforce authentication and authorization, ensuring users can only access their own projects and data.
Interactive visualizations in UI consume alignmentResults, gapAnalysisReport, and fundingStrategyPlan JSON data to render insights and allow user modifications.
validationRules: User registration requires valid email format, password minimum length and complexity, optional institution and eligibilityConstraints JSON validation.
Login requires existing email and correct password matching hashedPassword.
Research project creation requires non-empty title, abstract, objectives, and keywords array with at least one keyword.
Uploaded funder database files must be validated for JSON structure, required fields (funderId, name, programs), and reject malformed or inconsistent data.
API endpoints validate userId matches authenticated user session.
Modifications to funding strategy plans must conform to expected JSON schema (e.g., timeline dates, action items).
Eligibility constraints in user profile and project inputs must be JSON objects; conflicts between user and funder eligibility criteria should be flagged.
All inputs sanitized to prevent injection attacks and ensure data integrity.
errorHandling: API endpoints return standardized error responses with HTTP status codes (400 for validation errors, 401 for unauthorized, 404 for not found, 500 for server errors).
File upload errors return descriptive messages for malformed or unsupported formats.
Alignment and analysis failures return partial results with warnings; errors logged for investigation.
Background job failures trigger notifications to admin and log detailed error reports.
Unauthorized access attempts return 401 with message prompting login or insufficient permissions.
Network or integration API failures handled with retries and fallback to last known good data.
Conflicting eligibility constraints result in user-facing warnings with suggestions to resolve.
securityNotes: Passwords stored hashed with strong algorithm (e.g., bcrypt) and never returned in API responses.
Authentication tokens issued securely with expiration and stored in HttpOnly cookies or secure storage.
All API routes except login and register require authentication and verify user ownership of resources.
File uploads scanned for malware and size-limited to prevent denial of service.
Sensitive user data (eligibility constraints, institutional affiliation) access restricted and encrypted at rest.
Rate limiting on public-facing endpoints to prevent brute force and abuse.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communications.
